references: To combine these advantages, a hierarchical FL system is considered, which has one cloud server, s𝑠s edge servers indexed by ℓℓ\ell, with disjoint client sets {𝒞ℓ}ℓ=1ssuperscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝒞ℓℓ1𝑠\{\mathcal{C}^{\ell}\}_{\ell=1}^{s}, and n𝑛n clients indexed by i𝑖i and ℓℓ\ell, with distributed datasets {𝒟iℓ}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝒟𝑖ℓ𝑖1𝑁\{\mathcal{D}_{i}^{\ell}\}_{i=1}^{N}. Other key notations that are important for the algorithm and the theoretical analysis are summarized in Table I. The hierarchical FL system exploits the natural client-edge-cloud communication hierarchy in current communication networks.

. Next, by applying the theoretical analysis to a system design problem, i.e., the aggregation interval selection problem, we will illustrate how the analytical result can be used to reduce the overall training latency in hierarchical federated learning.
